column1: '''Lá Húru''' is a poem by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]
column2: sung to the tune of "Are You the O'Reilly Who Keeps This Hotel?" The poem was composed by Tolkien ca. [[1924]]. It was published in ''[[Songs for the Philologists]]'' in [[1936]].<ref name=Leeds>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://library.leeds.ac.uk/special-collections-explore/378427|articlename=Archive File: Syx Mynet and Lá Húru|dated=|website=[http://library.leeds.ac.uk/ library.leeds.ac.uk]|accessed=9 May 2017}}</ref>

column1: The poem was rendered in pen and ink
column3: on one leaf. The manuscript is kept in the Tolkien-Gordon Collection at the Library of the [[University of Leeds]].<ref name=Leeds/>
